column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
TorontoAFIBguy, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Persistent or permanent aFibber for 2-5 years until diagnosed! First ECV ineffective (quack cardiologist did not know what he was doing). Changed to top rated cardio/EP in top rated hospital. My left atrium had enlarged and was not candidate for ablation. Plan is to take Tikosyn for as long as it takes for my LA to shrink to normal; then ablation(s) as required and Tikosyn as required. Three days in hospital for Tik uptake and required ECV to put me into NSR. Have been in NSR since Dec 2011 99.99% or have simply had skipped beats when my Potassium has gone low. Drink lots of Low Sodium V8 and supplement 2g Potassium daily. Avoid caffeine, MSG, salt, etc. and feel pretty good since December but noticing side effects as of late (mild nausea in mornings, erratic sleep, anxiety, etc.). Overall am a happy camper and hope Tik keeps working for me. It is not for everyone but if you tolerate it and any side effects it is A1. Watch for drug interactions and for supply shortages! Take exactly EXACTLY as directed (I have an alarm set for 10AM and 10PM). Avoid trigger foods.

column9: Been on Tikosyn 26+ months with one AF after 19 months (had cardioversion and resumed Tikosyn). No noticeable side affects but am borderline with long QT. WARNING!! YOU must check for interactions with any other prescribed drugs: I had two drugs separately prescribed by a GP and then a Cardiologist that could both have resulted in death even though they were advised in writing and discussed with both doctors and the pharmacists! Check every prescribed drug yourself for interactions!!!! Trust no one. Wonder drug for me.

column9: I started using tikosyn about 2 months ago for afib that was occuring at least 2x per day. column2: 55-64 Female  (Patient)
column9: I seem to be the only one using it for Ventricular Tachycardia. I have had a defibrilator since Jan. In march they told me to "push It" I did and got de-fibed hard. In August I wasn't even doing any thing, went into v-tach, go full defib 3 times, it didn't work, but I came out of the V-Tach. Cardiologist decided on Tikosyn, 500 mcg 2 x a day, in hospital for 3 days, then he put me out for about 20 minutes, reversed the polarity on my defibrilator leads. Won't know if Tikosyn is working until of if I go into V-Tach again. Side effects have been extreme exhaustion, low blood pressure. Reduced it to 250 mcg 2 x daily, feel better, but if I do much, all my joint ache and burn. They tell me this is not a side effect??? I am a 59 yr old woman.

column2: the Pacer, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Hospitalized in June 09 for 3 days to load the Tikosyn. No effect. Continued with 500 MCG (micrograms.) One lady here reported 250 to 375 MG (milligrams?) In Sept 09 I had an ablation. Then added metoprolol twice a day and diltiazem 4 times a day to lower my pulse. I do get some short periods of sinus rhythm which doctors say may be the result of the healing of the heart after the burning of the ablation. Another ablation may be in order.

column9: hospitalized 4 days; 250 mg 2x daily; after 2 days heart went back to sinus rhythm for 7 hrs only;  raised to 375 mg 2x daily; heart went back in 2 days for 10 minutes. medicine did not work for me;  released from hospital;  experienced no known side effects from the medicine. ablation recommended.

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
durtro060, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After years of using Amiodarone, which induced in me a thyroid problem (which is a nightmare to deal with) I finally got off that drug and tried to manage my AFib with electrical cardioversions as needed. After 3 zappings were needed in fairly quick succession earlier this year,we decided to try me on Tikosyn, and so far (6 weeks later) the results have been very satisfactory. My heartbeat feels solider than it has in ages, and that is reassuring and worth a lot! The only negatives I experience are very occasional 5 second bursts of rapid heartbeat, and the requirement to take the Tikosyn on a strict every 12 hours timetable.  This is hard for me as I travel a lot to different Time Zones. As an alternative to Amiodarone, I feel much happier using Tikosyn, because it does not have the long list of damaging side effects that Amiodarone does - reading those I wonder why it is still the drug of choice to treat Atrial Fibrillation.

column2: kate, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Was put on tikosyn for atrial fib and with just 2 doses my heart went back into sinus rhythm. was monitored for 3 days and have been feeling good after one week of treatment.

column2: FLS46, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: After 2 strokes, implantation of a pacemaker, multiple ablations, a maze procedure and 6 cardioversions over the course of 6 years I have now been on Tikosyn for 18 months, had only one significant A Fib event (which required cardioversion).  My only complaint is similar to one above: the supply from the manufacturer is spotty and unreliable.  The drug itself is a Godsend in my opinion - virtually all meds tried prior to Tikosyn had no effect whatsoever for me.

column2: Sis, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have not experienced any further symptoms of AF since starting Tikosyn.What I have experienced is difficulty getting certain other medical procedures completed because of the medication interaction problems. Dental procedures requiring local anesthetics are not possible since I can not use any of the "cains". Treatments for skin problems that might have steroids in them can not be used as steroids can cause an adverse reaction with Tikosyn. Since I'm so new to using this drug I expect it will take a while to learn how to get Medical procedures done without the use of typically used medications. I will be in contact with the manufacturer as will be my Pharmacist and Cardiologist to determine the proper course of action to take regarding the rest of my health care needs.

column9: My mom just spent part of the week in the hospital to get changed to this drug and now 3 days after leaving the hospital. She can't get anymore of it. column9: I was placed on tikosyn Aug/06 and didn't have a breakthrough until Aug/07.  I've had 3 breakthroughs since August. One in Aug, one is Sept and one in Nov.  I was cardio-verted in Aug and converted back on my own (with the help of God) in September & November.   This is a drug to be very careful with.

column2: LR, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: After initial 3 days in hospital for observation while starting drug, I was very pleased with results.  Definited decrease in symptoms leading to better life style.  I have been on Tikosyn for 1 year this month.

column9: My heart has basically been reframed.  My ejection-refraction rate rose from a low of 20% to a sustained 40%.
